name: الْفَصْلُ الرَّابِعُ : فِي مَوْلِدِهِ عَلَيْهِ الصَّلاَةُ وَالسَّلاَمُ
latin: Al-Fashlur Rābi’u: Fī Mawlidihī ‘Alaihis Shalātu was Salāmu

1.arabic: أَبَانَ مَوْلِدُهُ عَنْ طِيْبِ عُنْصُرِهِ ۞ يَا طِيْبَ مُبْتَدَإٍ مِنْهُ وَمُخْتَتَمِ
1.latin: Abāna mawliduhū ‘an thībi ‘unshurihī ۞ Yā thība mubtada-in minhu wa mukhtatami

2.arabic: يَوْمٌ تَفَرَّسَ فِيْهِ الْفُرْسُ أَنَّهُمُ ۞ قَدْ أُنْذِرُوا بِحُلُولِ الْبُؤْسِ وَالنِّقَمِ
2.latin: Yawmun tafarrasat fīhil fursu annahumu ۞ Qad undzirū bihulūlil bu’si wan-niqami

3.arabic: وَبَاتَ إِيْوَانُ كِسْرَى وَهْوَ مُنْصَدِعٌ ۞ كَشَمْلِ أَصْحَابِ كِسْرَى غَيْرَ مُلْتَئِمِ
3.latin: Wa bāta īwānu Kisrā wahwa munshadi’un ۞ Kasyamli ash-hābi Kisrā ghaira multa-imi

4.arabic: وَالنَّارُ خَامِدَةُ الْأَنْفَاسِ مِنْ أَسَفٍ ۞ عَلَيْهِ وَالنَّهْرُ سَاهِي الْعَيْنِ مِنْ سَدَمِ
4.latin: Wan nāru khāmidatul anfāsi min asafin ۞ ‘Alaihi wan nahru sāhil ‘aini min sadami

5.arabic: وَسَاءَ سَاوَةَ أَنْ غَاضَتْ بُحَيْرَتُهَا ۞ وَرُدَّ وَارِدُهَا بِالْغَيْظِ حِيْنَ ظَمِي
5.latin: Wa sā-a Sāwata an ghādhat buhairatuhā ۞ Wa rudda wāriduhā bil ghaizhi hīna zhamī

6.arabic: كَأَنَّ بِالنَّارِ مَا بِالْمَاءِ مِنْ بَلَلٍ ۞ حُزْنًا وَبِالْمَاءِ مَا بِالنَّارِ مِنْ ضَرَمِ
6.latin: Ka-anna binnāri mā bil mā-i min balalin ۞ Huznan wa bil mā-i mā binnāri min dharami

7.arabic: وَالْجِنُّ تَهِتِفُ وَالْأَنْوَارُ سَاطِعَةٌ ۞ وَالْحَقُّ يَظْهَرُ مِنْ مَعْنًى وَمِنْ كَلِمِ
7.latin: Wal jinnu tahtifu wal anwāru sāthi’atun ۞ Wal haqqu yazh-haru min ma’nan wa min kalimi

8.arabic: عَمُوا وَصَمُّوا فَإِعْلاَنُ الْبَشَائِرِ لَمْ ۞ تُسْمَعْ وَبَارِقَةُ الْإِنْذَارِ لَمْ تُشَمِ
8.latin: ‘Amū wa shammū fa i’lānul basyā-iri lam ۞ Tusma’ wa bāriqatul indzāri lam tusyami

9.arabic: مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا أَخْبَرَ الْأَقْوَامَ كَاهِنُهُمْ ۞ بِأَنَّ دِينَهُمُ الْمُعْوَجَّ لَمْ يَقُمِ
9.latin: Min ba’di mā akhbaral aqwāma kāhinuhum ۞ Bi anna dīnahumul mu’wajja lam yaqumi

10.arabic: وَبَعْدَ مَا عَايَنُوْا فِي الْأُفْقِ مِنْ شُهُبٍ ۞ مُنْقَضَّةٍ وَفْقَ مَا فِي الْأَرْضِ مِنْ صَنَمِ
10.latin: Wa ba’da mā ‘āyanū fil ufqi min syuhubin ۞ Munqadh-dhatin wafqa mā fil ardhi min shanami

11.arabic: حَتَّى غَدَا عَنْ طَرِيقِ الْوَحْيِ مُنْهَزِمٌ ۞ مِنَ الشَّيَاطِينِ يَقْفُو إِثْرَ مُنْهَزِمِ
11.latin: Hattā ghadā ‘an tharīqil wahyi munhazimun ۞ Minasy syayāthīni yaqfū itsra munhazimi

12.arabic: كَأَنَّهُمْ هَرَبًا أَبْطَالُ أَبْرَهَةَ ۞ أَوْ عَسْكَرٍ بِالْحَصَى مِنْ رَاحَتَيْهِ رُمِي
12.latin: Ka annahum haraban abthālu Abrahati ۞ Aw ‘askarin bil hashā min rāhataihi rumī

13.arabic: نَبْذًا بِهِ بَعْدَ تَسْبِيحٍ بِبَطْنِهِمَا ۞ نَبْذَ الْمُسَبِّحِ مِنْ أَحْشَاءِ مُلْتَقِمِ
13.latin: Nabdzan bihi ba’da tasbīhin bibathnihimā ۞ Nabdzal musabbihi min ahsyā-i multaqimi

id.name: Pasal Keempat: Tentang Kelahiran Nabi SAW
id.muqaddimah: Pasal ini menceritakan peristiwa-peristiwa ajaib (irhas) yang mengiringi kelahiran Nabi Muhammad SAW, sebagai tanda hancurnya kebatilan (Kerajaan Persia) dan terbitnya cahaya kebenaran.

text.1: Kelahirannya menampakkan kesucian unsur (nasab)-nya. Alangkah indahnya permulaan dan penghabisan (hidup)-nya.
text.2: Hari dimana bangsa Persia merasa (mendapat firasat) bahwa mereka telah diperingatkan akan datangnya bencana dan siksa.
text.3: Dan (pada malam itu) Istana Kisra retak-retak, sebagaimana barisan tentara Kisra yang terpecah belah dan tidak dapat bersatu lagi.
text.4: Dan api (sesembahan Persia) padam nafasnya karena duka cita atasnya (kelahiran Nabi), dan sungai (Eufrat) lupa mengalir karena kesedihan.
text.5: Dan penduduk Sawah bersedih karena danau mereka menjadi kering, dan pengambil air pulang dengan kemarahan serta kehausan.
text.6: Seakan-akan pada api itu terdapat sifat air (basah) karena duka, dan pada air terdapat sifat api (menyala) karena panasnya kesedihan.
text.7: Dan jin-jin berteriak (memberi kabar), dan cahaya-cahaya bersinar, dan kebenaran tampak dari makna dan kata-kata.
text.8: Mereka (orang-orang kafir) buta dan tuli, sehingga kabar gembira tidak didengar, dan kilatan peringatan tidak dilihat.
text.9: Setelah para dukun mereka memberitahu kaumnya, bahwa agama mereka yang bengkok itu tidak akan tegak lagi.
text.10: Dan setelah mereka melihat bintang-bintang di ufuk berjatuhan, seiring dengan berjatuhannya berhala-berhala di bumi.
text.11: Sehingga setan-setan lari terbirit-birit menjauhi jalan wahyu, mereka lari mengikuti jejak kekalahan.
text.12: Seakan-akan mereka yang lari itu adalah pasukan Abraha (Tentara Gajah), atau pasukan yang dilempari kerikil dari kedua telapak tangan beliau.
text.13: Beliau melemparkannya setelah kerikil itu bertasbih di dalam genggamannya, sebagaimana terlemparnya orang yang bertasbih (Nabi Yunus) dari perut ikan yang menelannya.

en.name: Chapter Four: Concerning His Birth
en.muqaddimah: This chapter recounts the miraculous signs accompanying the birth of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH), marking the decline of false powers like the Persian Empire and the rise of the Truth.

text.1: His birth revealed the purity of his origin. Oh, the excellence of such a beginning and such an end!
text.2: A day when the Persians perceived a warning that misery and punishment were descending upon them.
text.3: And the Palace of Chosroes spent the night cracked, just as the army of Chosroes was scattered, never to be reunited.
text.4: And the sacred fire died out, its breath extinguished from grief over him, and the river forgot its source from sorrow.
text.5: And Sawa was saddened that its lake dried up, and the one coming to drink was turned back in anger and thirst.
text.6: As if the fire had the wetness of water due to grief, and the water had the burning of fire.
text.7: And the Jinn were shouting (the news), and lights were shining, and the truth appeared in both meaning and word.
text.8: They were blind and deaf, so the announcement of good tidings was not heard, nor was the lightning of warning seen.
text.9: After their soothsayers had informed the people that their crooked religion would not stand.
text.10: And after they saw shooting stars on the horizon falling, just as idols fell upon the earth.
text.11: Until the devils were defeated and driven away from the path of revelation, fleeing one after another.
text.12: As if in their flight they were the heroes of Abraha (the Elephant Army), or the army pelted with pebbles from his two palms.
text.13: Thrown by him after they glorified God in his hands; like the throwing of the one who glorified God (Jonah) from the entrails of the swallower.
